author: akyar.ozgur
title: Organised Linkedin of professionals
description: Lack of awareness of Cardano and Project Catalyst as the most active open innovation platform among professionals.

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal raises an interesting idea, focusing on the promotion of Project Catalyst and Cardano in general in specific portals where professional profiles move can be of great benefit, this because, according to the author, there is a lack of awareness about everything related to Cardano. So he proposes to set up a team on linkedin where Cardano can be promoted in an organized way for the generation and publication of content and invites members of the community to join. Unfortunately it is clear that the author did not have the opportunity to complete this proposal, it is not possible to make an impact evaluation if you do not know the target population to be addressed through linkedin. This social network is very large and in order to have the best results it is necessary to define the target user and plan the content and outreach campaigns from there. It is also necessary to evaluate the appropriate impact by having well-defined metrics and, if possible, framed in a time range. I invite the author of the proposal to take my feedback and that of the rest of the community so that he can present a robust proposal for the next fund.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility there is no information available to make a proper evaluation, so I recommend to the voters not to approve this proposal. Now in the spirit of inviting proposers to prepare for the next fund, here are some ideas (beyond those already in the proposer's guide) that I can think of in terms of feasibility to address this type of problem. First of all, have someone on the team with a marketing backgroung, if possible who knows everything that has to do with Facebook, Google and Linkedin adds and allocate a budget item not only for the cost of advertising, but for the planning and maintenance of the campaign. I would also recommend a member with a background in online content creation, the best way to do engagement is to create valuable content for the target audience, so with your knowledge of the ecosystem combined with a good professional in this area would be a good start. Talking a bit about the plan, it is necessary to create a funnel workflow thinking about the steps that this target user would have to go through to become part of the community. Now the team has to define what it would mean to be part of the community. Wallet creation? Registration in Project Catalyst? Active participation in Discord groups? This would have to be defined by you. It is also necessary to think what would be the main risks for the money invested in campaigns to be as profitable as possible, some risks are the clearest of course that the potential new risk does not complete the workflow funnel, from there you would have to think countermeasures to reduce that risk, and so for all the general risks that you identify.
f6_assessments.q2: In the Auditability section there is also not enough information to make a complete assessment, so now I focus on presenting suggested metrics / KPIs for the proponent to consider for future funding. Beyond the obvious step of analyzing the metrics suggested in the challenge setting. I would recommend the following metrics: Number of user members in the linkedin group, level of user participation in the group, conversion rate, number of leads (define what a lead would be for the project), cost of acquiring new users, number of users that start the funnel workflow vs. users that finish, etc. There are many more but it will depend on the focus you want to give to your project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal probably needed to be withdrawn, as it is not fully complete, but I wanted to give the proposer a thumbs up for the general idea of organizing Cardano enthusiast on LinkedIn in order to generate viable presence.  The issues with the idea are mostly in principle:  linkedIn is a centralized hub with legacy hierarchical threads in its DNA (think of things like the High-level connections) that could be doing a lot more, given its nature, to promote organic networks, emergent leadership, etc.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is incomplete, and has not included its timeline, team members, budget breakdown, any actionable tasks or any resources required to complete the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is incomplete and has not included a road map, milestones, any metrics or KPIs that could measure progress, or allow the proposal to be tracked.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to introduce Catalys into LinkedIn through content sharing plus weekly meetings, thus bringing more professionals into Cardano Ecosystem. However, the proposal does not give any detail on how and what kind of content they want to create, they also do not provide in a big picture what will be discussed in the weekly meeting. Furthermore, the proposal also doesn't give information on the potential risks they may face, let alone how to overcome them.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal did not provide any information on the timeline or roadmap, number and qualification of team member(s) required, or even how the proposer will use the budget. For the budget, the proposal can state they need a zoom license for the weekly meeting, or to paid guest speaker, as an example.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal doesn't provide any metrics/KPI that define the success and state ‘Will be updated with team members’. They can metrics for success as the number of LinkedIn group members, the number of participants on each meeting, or the number of a meeting held successfully. For the indicators of success, they can add the number of LinkedIn members that actually joined Catalyst, for example.

I find the proposed idea very exciting, as I think it's crucial to open new channels to recruit more contributors into the community. LinkedIn is one of the most popular channels to recruit professionals that the community needs to raise the bar of the Catalyst proposals and the ideas presented, which is one of the main objectives of the challenge.

The problem perfectly aligns with the campaign's challenge; however, I found that the proposal lacks the solution's details that address the depicted problem; for example, the proposal doesn't state the type of content produced and the areas covered to effectively onboard passive ADA holders to contribute to the Catalyst community actively.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal doesn't have clear information about the plan or the team, and the solution was also very ambiguous with not enough details on the type and frequency of the content shared by the team members.

Additionally, the skill-set required to produce such high-quality content that would effectively spread the word about the Catalyst community and potentially recruit more professionals is hard to acquire by a single team member.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal didn't explain how to measure the progress or the set of metrics to track. However, LinkedIn provides high-level metrics for group admins to measure the reachability and effectiveness of the content posted, which can be helpful to measure the progress and success of the proposed solution.

f6_assessments.q2: As can be seen, there is little information about the proposers in this proposal, making it difficult to assess its viability. Second, there is no indication in this suggestion that a roadmap is needed. It's odd that there haven't been any Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) or Metrics (Metrics). This is uncommon in that we only learn about the entire budget. There is just too little information offered; everything comes to a halt at the concept level. This, though, I believe is a good concept. I'm hoping that the author will finish it in the next Fund, it can be Fund 9!. To sum up, I strongly oppose the auditability of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
IMPACT:
The adoption and growth of Project Catalyst is a collective work effort between proposers, advisors, mentors, and voters. In this context, the proposer identifies a problem, by describing the lack of Cardano and Project Catalyst awareness among professionals. The solution he offers is the promote Project Catalyst content through professional channels to support development and generate adoption. The way the proposer communicates how this will add value to the Cardano ecosystem is by describing his collaboration and volunteering labor on promoting Cardano using his professional account for about a year. There are not metrics or goals specified in this proposal that are align with the challenge aspects. In addition, there is not explanation on how this proposal will be able to scale future challenges.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a great proposal focused on the coordinated promotion of project catalyst through professional channels for bringing more professionals on board to support development. Regarding impact, some issues that should be noted are as follows:
first, as can be seen, the problem statement is clear and suitable for the given challenge, solving this problem may have positive contributions for achieving this challenge's goals and KPIs. Indeed, the problem this proposal is interested in solving is very good and potential, because Linkedin is a popular social networking platform for office workers and experts from many different fields. If they are attracted to come on board, it will contribute to achieving the goals of this challenge in particular and of the Cardano ecosystem in general. However, it is very regrettable that the proposer has not been able to finalize the proposal, currently many details of the solution have not been described and clarified; this makes the proposed solution unclear due to lack of detail for supporting some important information (such as roadmap with timeline, KPIs/metrics for measuring the success,...) and it failed to show a clear positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
In conclusion, I disagree with the impact of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding the possible, there are some issues that should be noted, including:
In general, this proposal has many potential impacts (as analyzed above), however, because many details have not been finalized, there is really no basis to agree on the feasibility of this proposal. Specifically, this proposal did not provide any meaningful information of team members and there is not any information that shows the proposer's demo/pilot/prototype/similar works completed in the past. Additionally, this proposal did not provide any goal/target, KPIs/metrics, roadmap, budget breakdown, and risk with mitigation, this shows that the proposer has not fully looked at what could happen during the implementation of this proposal.
Therefore, based on the provided information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's feasibility
